channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7361] Fix all javadoc warnings in hbase-server/{,mapreduce}
item.summary: Fix all javadoc warnings in hbase-server/{,mapreduce}

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This change gets us most of the way there for this portion of this module. Mose of the changes are innocuous. I also update the pom to take advantage of the new detectLinks feature available as of javadoc-2.6.

Two warnings remain:

org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/HBaseClient.java:1351: warning - Tag @link: can't find call(RpcRequestBody[], InetSocketAddress[], Class, User) in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient

I can't figure out the correct javadoc syntax for the intended method. I believe it's the Class argument which is incorrect.

org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/HBaseServer.java:200: warning - Tag @link: can't find call(Class, RpcRequestBody, long, MonitoredRPCHandler) in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseServer

I don't know where this could be pointing.

Please double-check: the updated description of intended usage of the HFileBlock.Writer class.
This is great. Just skimmed over it. In some places you replaced @link's with @code's. Is this needed because we have separated modules?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12561084/7361-fix-javadoc-warnings.0.diff
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any additional warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 26 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.TestDelayedRpc

-1 core zombie tests. There are zombie tests. See build logs for details.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3557//testReport/

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3557//console

This message is automatically generated.
Waiting till Enis gets an answer before committing. Patch looks good to me on skim.

Enis Soztutar

In some places you replaced @link's with @code's. Is this needed because we have separated modules?

For the autoFlush lines, there is no class member to link to. In the case of TestRowProcessorEndpoint, I believe our javadoc module is not configured to include the test directories. The FileLink change happens inside the FileLink class, so no need for an external link.

This patch differs from the previous only in that I cleaned up some whitespace and line length issues introduced by the previous patch.

Outstanding issues re: the two remaining warnings persist.
Committed to trunk. Thanks Nick.

For the autoFlush lines, there is no class member to link to. In the case of TestRowProcessorEndpoint, I believe our javadoc module is not configured to include the test directories. The FileLink change happens inside the FileLink class, so no need for an external link.

Thanks for the explanation. Makes sense.

Outstanding issues re: the two remaining warnings persist.

I guess we can do an addendum issue if you want to resolve those as well.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12561325/7361-fix-javadoc-warnings.1.diff
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

I have an addendum for the last two warnings.
The last two warnings are caused by the inclusion of protobuf-generated classes. We currently exclude the generated packages from javadocs, so these references will not properly resolve.

The last two warnings are caused by the inclusion of protobuf-generated classes. We currently exclude the generated packages from javadocs, so these references will not properly resolve. Also remove the link detection as that appears to not really work in practice.
